{{disambig-more|Hengest and Horsa|[[Hengest and Horsa (disambiguation)]]}} {{anglosaxon infobox | name=Hengest and Horsa | image= | caption= | people=[[wikipedia:Angles (tribe)|Angles]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position=Chieftains of the [[wikipedia:Anglo-Saxons|Anglo-Saxons]] | location=[[wikipedia:Heligoland|Heligoland]]
[[Tol Eressëa]] (Hengest in [[Kortirion]] & Horsa in [[Taruithorn]]): after the [[Faring Forth]] | affiliation= | language=[[Old English]] | birth=[[wikipedia:5th century|5th century AD]] | birthlocation=[[wikipedia:Heligoland|Heligoland]] | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor=Invasion of Tol Eressëa (i.e. [[wikipedia:England|England]]) | house= | parentage=[[Eriol]] & [[Cwén]] | siblings=[[Heorrenda]] & ''possibly'' [[Hendwine]][[Hengest and Horsa#Genealogy|NB]] (half-brothers) | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Hengest''' and '''Horsa''' were the elder sons of [[Eriol]], and one of the [[Men|Mannish]] conquerors of [[Tol Eressëa]] following the [[Faring Forth]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.{{LT1|In}}, pp. 23-4 == History == === Early history === Hengest and Horsa were born during the [[wikipedia:5th century|5th century AD]] in [[wikipedia:Heligoland|Heligoland]], an island off the coast of the [[Great Lands]], to Eriol and his wife [[Cwén]]. While Hengest and Horsa were still children, their mother died, and their father went to seek [[Tol Eressëa]], the island of the [[Elves]] in the [[West]]. After the brothers grew up, they sought vengeance on their uncle [[Beorn (son of Heden)|Beorn]] for the murder of their grandfather [[Eoh]], and afterwards became great chieftains among their people. === The Faring Forth === Following the [[Faring Forth]], the disastrous attempt by the Elves of Tol Eressëa to save their [[Ilkorindi|kin]] in the Great Lands which resulted in their total defeat and eventual fading, evil Men invaded Tol Eressëa, which was now anchored near the coast of the Great Lands.{{LT2|VI}}, p. 293According to one outline, in which it was Eriol himself who hastened the Faring Forth, Hengest and Horsa were said to have conquered the ''[[Guiðlin]]'' (i.e. [[wikipedia:Gaels|Gaels]]), one of the peoples that invaded Tol Eressëa during the Faring Forth.{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''14''', p. 294 However, some time after, Hengest and Horsa (alongside their half-brother [[Heorrenda]]) invaded Tol Eressëa as well, which would in later days become known as ''[[wikipedia:England|England]]''. There, Hengest established his capital at what was once the city of [[Kortirion]], which would later be known as ''Warwíc'' (in [[Old English]]), and eventually as ''[[wikipedia:Warwick|Warwick]]''; meanwhile Horsa established himself at what was once the town of [[Taruithorn]], which would later be known as ''Oxenaford'' (in [[Old English]]), and eventually as ''[[Oxford]]''.{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''13''', pp. 291-2 Unlike all other Men that invaded the island, however, the sons of Eriol (Hengest, Horsa, and Heorrenda) were friendly to the Elves, and it is through them that the [[wikipedia:English people|English people]] retained the "true tradition of the [[Elves|fairies]]". == Etymology == The names ''Hengest'' and ''Horsa'' are in [[Old English]], with ''Hengest'' meaning "stallion",{{PE|15}}, "[[Early Runic Documents]]", p. 91 and ''Horsa'' meaning "horse".{{webcite|website=Behind the Name|articlename=Horsa|articleurl=http://www.behindthename.com/name/horsa}} == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | | | WOD | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |WOD=[[wikipedia:Odin|Wóden]]}} {{familytree | | | |:| | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |}} {{familytree | | | |:| | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |}} {{familytree | | | HED | | | | | | | | | | | | | | TUL | | | | VAL |HED=[[Heden]]|TUL=[[Tulkastor]]|VAL=[[Valwë]]}} {{familytree | |,|-|^|-|.| | | | | | | | | | | |,|-|^|-|.| | | |!| |}} {{familytree | BEO | | EOH | | | | | | | | | | SIB | | VAI |~| LIN |BEO=[[Beorn (son of Heden)|Beorn]]

[[wikipedia:5th century|5th century]]''}} {{familytree/end}} * The name of Hendwine's mother is not Naimi but ''[[Nelmir]]'' in the text on which the basis of his inclusion is founded upon - neither is her relation to [[Lindo]] and [[Vairë (wife of Lindo)|Vairë]] elaborated on.{{PE|15}}, "[[Names and Required Alterations]]", Appendix, ''Text X'', p. 17 == Inspiration == The characters of Hengest and Horsa from ''The Book of Lost Tales'' were based on the [[wikipedia:Hengist and Horsa|legendary leaders]] of the Anglo-Saxon invasion of [[wikipedia:Great Britain|Britain]] in the 5th century AD. {{references|notes}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hengest and Horsa}} [[Category:Angles]] [[Category:Characters in The Book of Lost Tales]] [[Category:Rulers in Tol Eressëa]]
